get.summary: Get all invoices
get.description: Gets a list of invoices, by default from the past 4 weeks. The optional period-start-date and period-end-date-date parameters can be used together to retrieve invoices from a specific date range in the past, the period can be no longer than 31 days. Invoices and their specifications can be downloaded separately in different media formats with the ‘GET an invoice by id’ and the ‘GET an invoice specification by id’ calls. The available media types differ per invoice and are listed per invoice within the response. Note: the media types listed in the response must be given in our standard API format.

parameters.name: period-start-date
parameters.description: Period start date in ISO 8601 standard.

parameters.name: period-end-date
parameters.description: Period end date in ISO 8601 standard.

400.description: Bad request: The sent request does not meet the API specification. Please check the error message(s) for more information.

Currently this endpoint only supports the allowable retail price and can support the following use cases:

1) EANs that have been unpublished due to price related reasons can be checked against this endpoint.
2) Requesting the allowable retail price for EANs that are not yet in your assortment can help inform price setting.

get.summary: Gets the status of an asynchronous process by entity id and event type for a retailer
get.description: Retrieve a list of process statuses, which shows information regarding previously executed PUT/POST/DELETE requests in descending order. You need to supply an entity id and event type. Please note: process status instances are only retained for a limited period of time after completion. Outside of this period, deleted process statuses will no longer be returned. Please handle this accordingly, by stopping any active polling for these statuses.

parameters.name: entity-id
parameters.description: The entity id is not unique so you need to provide an event type. The entity id can either be order item id, transport id, return number or inbound reference.

parameters.name: event-type
parameters.description: The event type can only be used in combination with the entity id.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The requested page number with a page size of 50 items.

400.description: Bad request: The sent request does not meet the API specification. Please check the error message(s) for more information.

post.summary: Gets the status of multiple asynchronous processes by an array of process status id's for a retailer
post.description: Retrieve a list of process statuses, which shows information regarding previously executed PUT/POST/DELETE requests. No more than 1000 process status id's can be sent in a single request.Please note: process status instances are only retained for a limited period of time after completion. Outside of this period, deleted process statuses will no longer be returned. Please handle this accordingly, by stopping any active polling for these statuses.

400.description: Bad request: The sent request does not meet the API specification. Please check the error message(s) for more information.

get.summary: Get the status of an asynchronous process by id
get.description: Retrieve a specific process-status, which shows information regarding a previously executed PUT/POST/DELETE request. All PUT/POST/DELETE requests on the other endpoints will supply a process-status-id in the related response. You can use this id to retrieve a status by using the endpoint below. Please note: process status instances are only retained for a limited period of time after completion. Outside of this period, a 404 will be returned for missing process statuses. Please handle this accordingly, by stopping any active polling for these statuses.

parameters.name: process-status-id
parameters.description: The id of the process status being requested. This id is supplied in every response to a PUT/POST/DELETE request on the other endpoints.

404.description: Not found: The requested item could not be found.

serviceType.description: An additional service type that the customer selected when purchasing this order item.

id.description: Identifier of the attribute from the data model.

unitId.description: The unit identifier of the attribute.

firstName.description: The first name of the customer.

houseNumberExtension.description: The extension on the house number.

extraAddressInformation.description: Additional information related to the address that helps in delivering the package.

zipCode.description: The ZIP code in '1234AB' format for NL orders and '0000' format for BE orders.

email.description: A scrambled email address that can be used to contact the customer.

vatNumber.description: The Value Added Tax (VAT) / BTW number for business sellers situated in the Netherlands.

kvkNumber.description: The Kamer van Koophandel (kvk) number for organizations situated in the Netherlands or ondernemingsnummer for organizations situated in Belgium.

orderReference.description: The order reference specified by the customer when ordering a product.

BillingDetails.description: The details of the customer that is responsible for the financial fulfillment of this order.

ean.description: The EAN number associated with this product.

unitPrice.description: The price of the product with a period as a decimal separator. The price should always have two decimals precision.

quantity.description: The minimum quantity a customer must order in order to receive discount. The element with value 1 must at least be present. In case of using more elements, the respective quantities must be in increasing order.

unitPrice.description: The price per single unit including VAT in case the customer orders at least the quantity provided. When using more than 1 price, the respective prices must be in decreasing order using 2 decimal precision and dot separated.

trackAndTrace.description: The track and trace code that is associated with this transport.

ean.description: The EAN number associated with this product.

unitPrice.description: The intended selling price per single unit up to 2 decimals precision, including VAT.

fixedAmount.description: A fixed commission fee, including VAT.

percentage.description: A percentage of commission, based on the intended selling price per unit, including VAT.

totalCost.description: The total commission for selling this product at bol.com. The price includes VAT for Dutch sellers, and excludes VAT for Belgium sellers.

totalCostWithoutReduction.description: The total commission for selling this product at bol.com without reductions including VAT.

name.description: The condition of the offered product.

category.description: The category of the condition. If not given NEW or SECONDHAND is derived from NAME.

comment.example: Heeft een koffie vlek op de kaft.
comment.description: The description of the condition of the product. Only allowed if name is not NEW and may not contain e-mail addresses.

orderItems.description: List of order items to cancel. Order item id's must belong to the same order.

countryCode.description: Countries in which this offer is currently on sale in the webshop, in ISO-3166-1 format

minimum.description: Minimum number of estimated sales expectations on the bol.com platform.

maximum.description: Maximum number of estimated sales expectations on the bol.com platform.

countryCode.description: Countries in which this offer is currently on sale in the webshop, in ISO-3166-1 format

value.description: The total value of offer insight.

countryCode.description: Countries in which this offer is currently on sale in the webshop, in ISO-3166-1 format

format.description: The file format in which to return the export.

ean.description: The EAN number associated with this product. Note: in case an ISBN is provided, the ISBN will be replaced with the actual EAN belonging to this ISBN.

reference.description: A user-defined reference that helps you identify this particular offer when receiving data from us. This element can optionally be left empty and has a maximum amount of 20 characters.

onHoldByRetailer.description: Indicates whether or not you want to put this offer for sale on the bol.com website. Defaults to false.

unknownProductTitle.description: In case the item is not known to bol.com you can use this field to identify this particular product. Note: in case the product is known to bol.com, the unknown product title will not be stored.

language.description: The language to indicate the language of the supplied content.

productContents.description: A list of supplied products and their attributes. Attributes that are required for publishing products online will be mentioned in the data model.

orderItemId.description: The id for the order item (1 order can have multiple order items).

handlingResult.description: The handling result requested by the retailer.

url.description: URL to receive this WebHook notification

format.description: The file format in which to return the export.

firstName.description: The first name of the customer.

houseNumberExtended.description: The extension on the house number.

extraAddressInformation.description: Additional information related to the address that helps in delivering the package.

zipCode.description: The ZIP code in '1234AB' format for NL orders and '0000' format for BE orders.

email.description: A scrambled email address that can be used to contact the customer.

deliveryPhoneNumber.description: The delivery phone number of the customer. Filled in case the order requires an appointment for delivering the goods.

vatNumber.description: The Value Added Tax (VAT) / BTW number for business sellers situated in the Netherlands.

timeSlots.description: An available timeslot to be reserved for inbound shipments.

shippingLabelOfferId.description: Unique identifier for the shipping label offer.

validUntilDate.description: The date until the delivery option (incl total price) is valid.

transporterCode.description: A code representing the transporter which is being used for transportation.

labelType.description: The type of the label, representing the way an item is being transported.

DeliveryOption.description: A delivery option shows how and the costs of a transport for a shippable configuration

orderItems.description: Order items for which the delivery options are requested.

DeliveryOptionsRequest.description: The configuration of order items to get delivery options for.

DeliveryOptionsResponse.description: The possible delivery options based on a shippable configuration

period.description: The period for which the performance is measured.

score.description: The score for this measurement. In case there are no scores for an indicator, this element is omitted from the response.

method.description: Specifies whether this shipment has been fulfilled by the retailer (FBR) or fulfilled by bol.com (FBB). Defaults to FBR.

deliveryCode.description: The delivery promise that applies to this offer. This value will only be used in combination with fulfilmentMethod 'FBR'.

pickUpPoints.description: Indicates whether this order is shipped to a Pick Up Point.

meetsCustomerExpectation.description: Indicates if you can use this label without receiving a strike if you handover before the latestHandoverDateTime. If this field is 'false' you can still buy and use this label but it will have negative consequences on your performance score because the order will be delivered too early or too late.

latestHandoverDateTime.description: The date and time at which the parcel must ultimately be at the transporter to make sure your parcel is delivered on time. If you handover after this date you will receive a strike because you order will be delivered too late.

collectionMethod.description: The type of collection for this parcel.

inboundId.description: A unique identifier for an inbound shipment.

reference.description: A user defined reference to identify the inbound shipment.

creationDateTime.description: The date and time the inbound shipment was created, in ISO 8601 format.

state.description: The current state of the inbound shipment.

labellingService.description: Indicates whether the inbound will be labeled by bol.com or not.

receivedBSKUs.description: Number of lines that were scanned in our warehouse. This value does not provide the unique number of received bsku's.

timeSlot.description: The timeslot within which your shipment is expected to arrive at the warehouse.

ean.description: The EAN number associated with this product.

reference.description: A user defined reference to identify the inbound shipment.

timeSlot.description: The timeslot within which your shipment is expected to arrive at the warehouse.

labellingService.description: Indicates whether the inbound will be labeled by bol.com or not.

ean.description: The EAN number associated with this product.

bsku.description: The BSKU number associated with this product.

gradedStock.description: The stock that is not available for sale anymore.

regularStock.description: The stock that is available for sale.

id.description: Key identifier. Maps to the keyId value in the signature header of the push request.

publicKey.description: The Base64 encoded public key to use when verifying the signature.

totalPrice.description: The price that is charged for this delivery option, excluding VAT.

code.description: Error code signalling that the offer is invalid.

description.description: Error message describing the reason the offer is invalid.

name.description: The name of the requested offer insight.

type.description: Interpretation of the data that applies to this measurement.

total.description: Total number of customer visits on the product page when the offer had the buy box over the requested period (excluding the current day).

pickUpPoint.description: Indicates whether this order is shipped to a Pick Up Point.

orderPlacedDateTime.description: The date and time in ISO 8601 format when the order was placed.

method.description: Specifies whether this shipment has been fulfilled by the retailer (FBR) or fulfilled by bol.com (FBB). Defaults to FBR.

distributionParty.description: The party that manages the distribution, either bol.com or the retailer itself.

latestDeliveryDate.description: The ultimate delivery date at which this order must be delivered at the customer's shipping address. This field is empty in case the exactDeliveryDate is filled.

exactDeliveryDate.description: The exact delivery date at which this order must be delivered at the customer's shipping address. This field is only filled when the customer chose an exact date for delivery. This field is empty in case the latestDeliveryDate is filled.

expiryDate.description: The date this order item will automatically expire and thereby cancelling this order item from the order.

orderItemId.description: The id for the order item (1 order can have multiple order items).
The id for the order item (1 order can have multiple order items).

reasonCode.description: The code representing the reason for cancellation of this item.

reference.description: A user-defined reference tied to the offer upon creating the offer.

orderItemId.description: The id for the order item (1 order can have multiple order items).

cancellationRequest.description: Indicates whether the order was cancelled on request of the customer before the retailer has shipped it.

quantity.description: Amount of ordered products for this order item id.

unitPrice.description: The selling price to the customer of a single unit including VAT.

commission.description: The commission for all quantities of this order item.

OrderOrderItem.description: Order item details from an order.

ean.description: The EAN number associated with this product.

title.description: Title of the product as shown on the webshop.

type.description: Interpretation of the data that applies to this measurement.

week.description: Week number in the ISO-8601 standard.

year.description: Year number in the ISO-8601 standard.

total.description: Total number of customer visits on the product page when the offer had the buy box over the requested period (excluding the current day).

bundlePrices.description: A set of prices (containing a quantity and selling price) that apply to this offer.

type.description: Type URI for this problem. Fixed value: https://api.bol.com/problems.

title.example: Error validating request body. Consult the bol.com API documentation for more information.
title.description: Title describing the nature of the problem.

status.description: HTTP status returned from the endpoint causing the problem.

detail.description: Detailed error message describing in additional detail what caused the service to return this problem.

host.description: Host identifier describing the server instance that reported the problem.

instance.description: Full URI path of the resource that reported the problem.

Problem.description: Describes a problem that occurred interacting with the API.

entityId.description: The id of the object being processed. E.g. in case of a shipment process id, you will receive the id of the order item being processed.

eventType.description: Name of the requested action that is being processed.

description.example: Example process status description for processing 987654321.
description.description: Describes the action that is being processed.

status.description: Status of the action being processed.

createTimestamp.description: Time of creation of the response.

links.description: Lists available actions applicable to this endpoint.

ean.description: The EAN number associated with this product.

bsku.description: The BSKU number associated with this product.

state.description: The current state of the inbound product.

internalReference.description: A user defined unique reference to identify the products in the upload.
A user defined unique reference to identify the products in the upload.

status.description: The end status of the rejected attribute.

errorDescription.description: The rejection error message explains why the value was rejected.

ean.description: The EAN number associated with this product.

quantity.description: Number of products to generate labels for.

format.description: The printer format to create labels for.

inboundId.description: A unique identifier for an inbound shipment.

reference.description: A user defined reference to identify the inbound shipment.

creationDateTime.description: The date and time the inbound shipment was created, in ISO 8601 format.

state.description: The current state of the inbound shipment.

labellingService.description: Indicates whether the inbound will be labeled by bol.com or not.

receivedBSKUs.description: Number of lines that were scanned in our warehouse. This value does not provide the unique number of received bsku's.

timeSlot.description: The timeslot within which your shipment is expected to arrive at the warehouse.

orderPlacedDateTime.description: The date and time in ISO 8601 format when the order was placed.

orderItemId.description: The id for the order item (1 order can have multiple order items).

ean.description: The EAN number associated with this product.

quantity.description: Amount of ordered products for this order item id.

registrationDateTime.description: The date and time in ISO 8601 format when this return was registered.

fulfilmentMethod.description: Specifies whether this shipment has been fulfilled by the retailer (FBR) or fulfilled by bol.com (FBB). Defaults to FBR.

rmaId.description: The RMA (Return Merchandise Authorization) id that identifies this particular return.

orderId.description: The id of the customer order this return item is in.

ean.description: The EAN number associated with this product.

expectedQuantity.description: The quantity that is expected to be returned by the customer. Note: this can be greater than 1 in case the customer ordered a quantity greater than 1 of the same product in the same customer order.

returnReason.description: The reason why the customer returned this product.

returnReasonComments.description: Additional details from the customer as to why this item was returned.

handled.description: Indicates if this return item has been handled (by the retailer).

shipmentId.description: A unique identifier for this shipment.

shipmentDateTime.description: The date and time in ISO 8601 format when the order item was shipped.

shipmentReference.description: Reference supplied by the user when this item was shipped.

orderItemId.description: A unique identifier for the item of the order that was shipped in this shipment.

ean.description: The EAN number associated with this product.

orderId.description: A unique identifier for the order this shipment is related to.

orderPlacedDateTime.description: The date and time in ISO 8601 format when the order was placed.

maximumPrice.description: Maximum offer price that can be used to benefit from a commission reduction, including VAT.

costReduction.description: A reduction to the commission if the maximum price criteria is met, including VAT.

startDate.description: The start date from which the commission reduction is valid, in ISO 8601 format.

endDate.description: The end date from which the commission reduction is not valid anymore, in ISO 8601 format.

attributeId.description: Identifier of the attribute from the data model.

message.description: The rejection error message explains why the value was rejected.

price.description: The retail price for this product with two decimals precision. The price includes VAT.

RetailPrice.description: Retail price information with the country in which it applies.

RetailPriceResponse.description: Retail price information for products and the countries in which they apply.

ean.description: The EAN number associated with this product. Note: in case an ISBN is provided, the ISBN will be replaced with the actual EAN belonging to this ISBN.

reference.description: A user-defined reference that helps you identify this particular offer when receiving data from us. This element can optionally be left empty and has a maximum amount of 20 characters.

onHoldByRetailer.description: Indicates whether or not you want to put this offer for sale on the bol.com website. Defaults to false.

unknownProductTitle.description: In case the item is not known to bol.com you can use this field to identify this particular product. Note: in case the product is known to bol.com, the unknown product title will not be stored.

registrationDateTime.description: The date and time in ISO 8601 format when this return was registered.

fulfilmentMethod.description: Specifies whether this shipment has been fulfilled by the retailer (FBR) or fulfilled by bol.com (FBB). Defaults to FBR.

rmaId.description: The RMA (Return Merchandise Authorization) id that identifies this particular return.

orderId.description: The id of the customer order this return item is in.

ean.description: The EAN number associated with this product.

title.example: Harry Potter en de steen der wijzen

expectedQuantity.description: The quantity that is expected to be returned by the customer. Note: this can be greater than 1 in case the customer ordered a quantity greater than 1 of the same product in the same customer order.

returnReason.description: The reason why the customer returned this product.

returnReasonComments.description: Additional details from the customer as to why this item was returned.

trackAndTrace.description: The track and trace code that is associated with this transport.

handled.description: Indicates if this return item has been handled (by the retailer).

processingResult.description: The processing result of the return.

handlingResult.description: The handling result requested by the retailer.

processingDateTime.description: The date and time in ISO 8601 format when the return was processed.

type.description: Interpretation of the data that applies to this measurement.

conforms.description: Indicates whether the score conforms to the bol.com service norm or not.

numerator.description: The top part of the fraction (above the line). This usually is the smaller number compared to the denominator.

denominator.description: The lower part of the fraction (below the line). This usually is the larger number compared to the the numerator.

value.description: The score for this measurement (denominator divided by the numerator).

distanceToNorm.description: The difference between the score and the bol.com service norm.

Score.description: The score for this measurement. In case there are no scores for an indicator, this element is omitted from the response.

shipmentId.description: A unique identifier for this shipment.

shipmentDateTime.description: The date and time in ISO 8601 format when the order item was shipped.

shipmentReference.description: Reference supplied by the user when this item was shipped.

pickUpPoint.description: Indicates whether this order is shipped to a Pick Up Point.

pickUpPointName.description: The name of Pick Up Point location this order needs to be shipped to.

firstName.description: The first name of the customer.

houseNumberExtension.description: The extension on the house number.

extraAddressInformation.description: Additional information related to the address that helps in delivering the package.

zipCode.description: The ZIP code in '1234AB' format for NL orders and '0000' format for BE orders.

email.description: A scrambled email address that can be used to contact the customer.

deliveryPhoneNumber.description: The delivery phone number of the customer. Filled in case the order requires an appointment for delivering the goods.

language.description: The language of the customer in case of contact.

ShipmentDetails.description: The address details where this order needs to be shipped to. This can be the customers' own address, a (company) business address or a Pick Up Point address.

method.description: Specifies whether this shipment has been fulfilled by the retailer (FBR) or fulfilled by bol.com (FBB). Defaults to FBR.

distributionParty.description: The party that manages the distribution, either bol.com or the retailer itself.

latestDeliveryDate.description: The ultimate delivery date at which this order must be delivered at the customer's shipping address. This field is empty in case the exactDeliveryDate is filled.

orderItemId.description: A unique identifier for the item of the order that was shipped in this shipment.

quantity.description: Amount of the product being ordered.

unitPrice.description: The selling price to the customer of a single unit including VAT.

orderId.description: A unique identifier for the order this shipment is related to.

orderPlacedDateTime.description: The date and time in ISO 8601 format when the order was placed.

orderItems.description: List of order items to ship. Order item id's must belong to the same order.

shipmentReference.description: A user-defined reference that you can provide to add to the shipment. Can be used for own administration purposes.

shippingLabelId.description: The identifier of the purchased shipping label.

transporterCode.description: Specify the transporter that will carry out the shipment.

trackAndTrace.description: The track and trace code that is associated with this transport.

orderItems.description: Order items for which the delivery options are requested.

shippingLabelOfferId.description: Shipping label offer id for which you request a shipping label.

ShippingLabelRequest.description: The configuration of order items to get delivery options for.

state.description: The state that was transitioned into.

stateDateTime.description: The transition date and time in ISO 8601 format.

amount.description: The amount of stock available for the specified product present in the retailers warehouse. Note: this should not be the FBB stock! Defaults to 0.

correctedStock.description: The amount of items in stock minus handled order and minus open orders. As compared to the stock you sent us. When this reaches zero, your offer will not be for sale on the shop.

managedByRetailer.description: Configures whether the retailer manages the stock levels or that bol.com should calculate the corrected stock based on actual open orders. In case the configuration is set to 'false', all open orders are used to calculate the corrected stock. In case the configuration is set to 'true', only orders that are placed after the last offer update are taken into account.

amount.description: The amount of stock available for the specified product present in the retailers warehouse. Note: this should not be the FBB stock! Defaults to 0.

managedByRetailer.description: Configures whether the retailer manages the stock levels or that bol.com should calculate the corrected stock based on actual open orders. In case the configuration is set to 'false', all open orders are used to calculate the corrected stock. In case the configuration is set to 'true', only orders that are placed after the last offer update are taken into account.

productTitle.description: The product title for the product associated with this offer.

id.description: A unique identifier for the subscription

url.description: URL to receive this WebHook notification

startDateTime.description: The timeslot start date and time in ISO 8601 format.

endDateTime.description: The timeslot end date and time in ISO 8601 format.

minimum.description: Minimum number of estimated sales expectations on the bol.com platform.

maximum.description: Maximum number of estimated sales expectations on the bol.com platform.

transporterCode.description: Specify the transporter that will carry out the shipment.

trackAndTrace.description: The track and trace code that is associated with this transport.

reference.description: A user-defined reference that helps you identify this particular offer when receiving data from us. This element can optionally be left empty and has a maximum amount of 20 characters.

onHoldByRetailer.description: Indicates whether or not you want to put this offer for sale on the bol.com website. Defaults to false.

unknownProductTitle.description: In case the item is not known to bol.com you can use this field to identify this particular product. Note: in case the product is known to bol.com, the unknown product title will not be stored.

amount.description: The amount of stock available for the specified product present in the retailers warehouse. Note: this should not be the FBB stock! Defaults to 0.

managedByRetailer.description: Configures whether the retailer manages the stock levels or that bol.com should calculate the corrected stock based on actual open orders. In case the configuration is set to 'false', all open orders are used to calculate the corrected stock. In case the configuration is set to 'true', only orders that are placed after the last offer update are taken into account.

url.description: URL to receive this WebHook notification

name.description: Describes the origin of the error, for instance a field or query parameter validation error.

reason.example: Request contains invalid value(s): 'INVALID', allowed values: ALLOWED_VALUE1, ALLOWED_VALUE2.
reason.description: Detailed description of the validation error that caused the problem.

Violation.description: Describes a violation that occurred interacting with the API.
